metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3145 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
BIND was improperly sequencing cleanup operations on upstream recursion fetch contexts, leading in some cases to a use-after-free error that can trigger an assertion failure and crash in named. Affects BIND 9.0.0 to 9.8.x, 9.9.0 to 9.9.11, 9.10.0 to 9.10.6, 9.11.0 to 9.11.2, 9.9.3-S1 to 9.9.11-S1, 9.10.5-S1 to 9.10.6-S1, 9.12.0a1 to 9.12.0rc1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.17').
